alert.note: Alert for Brunswick (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 12 at 7:49PM EST until January 13 at 6:00AM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Observed flooding changed to Minor severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Virginia... Meherrin River At Emporia affecting Southampton, City of Emporia and Greensville Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Virginia... Nottoway River Near Stony Creek affecting Sussex County. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Virginia... Meherrin River At Lawrenceville affecting Brunswick County. For the Chowan Basin...including Rawlings, Stony Creek, Sebrell, Lawrenceville, Emporia, Franklin...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Meherrin River at Lawrenceville. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:45 PM EST Friday the stage was 19.2 feet. - Bankfull stage is 15.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:45 PM EST Friday was 25.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight and continue falling to 4.2 feet Wednesday evening. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 19.3 feet on 11/24/2006. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 200 AM EST.
